timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: how about all our other builtin components? It seems their configs are still deleted during deployment.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: The type which is written into the config store is typically the short name plugin, lambda, and so on. Not the full name.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: why add a dependency? doesn't seem helpful and may break stuff
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: We need to make sure it doesn't get wiped out on deployments
replies.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: This isn't the way to fix it. We need a better fix to not remove builtin/nucleus components and their configurations. As I posted in the slack room, we still have topics getting removed during deployment. All CLI, Deployment, FSS, etc topics are removed which is very bad.
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Are all topics being removed for builtin/plugins or was it just parameters? Also, the nucleus is neither of them, so we still need a way to persist it
replies.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: The service root is being removed for builtins, so everything
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: That wasn't always happening, if service topics are removed shouldn't tests be failing?
replies.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: You would think so... but apparently not. It is definitely still happening
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: I think it may not fail because all our services create the node if it doesn't exist. I'd expect it to fail with something else, but again, apparently not
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Even if the service topics are being removed right now which we of course have to fix but all builtin/plugin services are dependencies of main aren't they? So even if we solve that doesn't mean persisting this nucleus component will just work
replies.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: the dependencies of main has nothing to do with persistence. They aren't in the new config map, so that's why they get removed
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: My understanding was that if something isn't a dependency of main it won't be started up on nucleus startup/restart, Nucleus component probably will never need service lifecycle so it might be okay for that but it's just useless to have anything else as a service but not in main's dependency tree
replies.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: Anyway, the way you're adding the dependency isn't correct. Main could already have a dependency list present which you aren't accounting for.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Do you mean there shouldn't be a default for this?
replies.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: Yes, there shouldn't be a default. If it isn't set, it should be null instead of empty string
replies.author: MikeDombo
